scheduler.generate
Class Week

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      java.util.AbstractList<E>
          java.util.Vector<java.lang.Integer>
              scheduler.generate.Week
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Integer>, java.util.Collection<java.lang.Integer>, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>, java.util.RandomAccess
public class Week
extends java.util.Vector<java.lang.Integer>
implements java.io.Serializable

Represents a selection of days of the week. No duplicate days are allowed. (No weeks w/ more than 7 days).

Author:
Eric Liebowitz
See Also:

fiveDayWeek

public static final Week fiveDayWeek
A 5-day week (Mon-Fri)

Constructor Detail

Week

public Week()
Creates a Week w/ no days in it

Week

public Week(int[] days)
Creates a week with the specified days in it. Duplicates are not allowed and will be ignored. Ints which do not represent valid days will raise a NotADayException. Asking for a Week w/ more then 7 days will raise an EightDayWeekException.

Parameters:
days - Array of ints representing what days should be in this week.

Week

public Week(java.util.Collection<java.lang.Integer> days)
Creates a week with the specified days in it. Duplicates are not allowed and will be ignored. Ints which do not represent valid days will raise a NotADayException. Asking for a Week w/ more then 7 days will raise an EightDayWeekException.

Parameters:
days - Collection of ints representing what days should be in this week.
Method Detail

add

public boolean add(int d)
            throws NotADayException,
                   EightDayWeekException
Adds a day to this week.

Parameters:
d - Day to add
Returns:
True if the day was added. False otherwise.
Throws:
NotADayException - if "d" is not one of the day constants defined in this class.
EightDayWeekException - if this week is already full (7 days)

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a String representing this object

Overrides:
toString in class java.util.Vector<java.lang.Integer>

getWeek

public java.util.Vector<java.lang.Integer> getWeek()
Returns a list representation of this Week's days, in order from Sunday to Saturday.

Returns:
a list (Vector) of Integers represeting that days in this Week

containsDay

public boolean containsDay(int d)
                    throws NotADayException
Determines whether a given day is in this Week.

Parameters:
d - Day in question
Returns:
whether "d" is in this Week
Throws:
NotADayException

isValidDay

public static boolean isValidDay(int d)
Determines whether a given day is valid. That is, if it is numerically greater-than-or-equal-to SUN and numerically less-than-or-equal-to SAT.

Parameters:
d - The day in question
Returns:
(d >= SUN && d <= SAT)

hasValidDays

public static boolean hasValidDays(java.util.Collection<java.lang.Integer> days)
Determines whetehr a given list of days contains all-valid days, where "valid" is determined by the "isValidDay" method.

Parameters:
days - The list of days to check
Returns:
True if all the days are a valid day. False otherwise.
